intro: Cassebeeria moluccana, commonly known as the Moluccan cassebeeria, is a flowering plant native to the Maluku Islands in Indonesia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It has lance-shaped leaves that are opposite on the stem and are often covered in fine hairs. Cassebeeria moluccana is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
